description.narrative: This award strives to save lives, alleviate suffering, and minimize the economic costs of conflict, disasters and displacement. Humanitarian assistance is provided on the basis of need according to principles of universality, impartiality and human dignity. More specifically, this includes .

To save lives, alleviate suffering, and minimize the economic costs of conflict, disasters and displacement. Humanitarian assistance is provided on the basis of need according to principles of universality, impartiality and human dignity. It is often organized by sectors, but requires an integrated, coordinated and/or multi-sectoral approach to be most effective. Emergency operations will foster the transition from relief, through recovery, to development, but they cannot and will not replace the development investments necessary to reduce chronic poverty or establish just social services.

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Following the 2014 national and Presidential elections, Namibia came under new leadership that is striving to put the country on a path of prosperity for all Namibians. However, Namibia continues to face formidable development challenges that could prevent it from reaching its full potential. Notwithstanding Namibia's classification as an upper middle-income country, these challenges include one of the highest levels of income disparity worldwide, a poorly performing education system, a high unemployment rate, an estimated 14 percent HIV prevalence rate, and a high co-infection rate of tuberculosis (TB). U.S. assistance to Namibia will focus on a transition to sustainability in a post-emergency HIV response, on programs to strengthen local capacity to respond to the HIV/AIDS epidemic, and efforts to strengthen the U.S. government's ongoing military cooperation with the Government of the Republic of Namibia.

title.narrative: U.S. General Services Administration Federal Government
